intro: Eschscholzia oregana, commonly known as the California poppy, is a flowering plant native to western North America. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red petals and is often found in dry, open habitats. The plant has a taproot system that allows it to thrive in well-drained soils. Its flowers are typically 2–4 inches in diameter and bloom from spring to early summer. Eschscholzia oregana is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
